Compile C++ code

Source: R/source_cpp.R
source_cpp.Rd

cpp_function() is a helper which makes it easier to compile a single function for use in R. eval_cpp() is a helper to evaluate a single expression and return the result.

source_cpp(file, code = NULL, env = parent.frame(), clean = TRUE, quiet = TRUE)

cpp_function(code, env = parent.frame())

eval_cpp(code)

Arguments

file

A file containing C++ code to compile
code

If non-null, the C++ code to compile
env

The R environment where the R wrapping functions should be defined.
clean

If TRUE, cleanup the files after sourcing
quiet

If 'TRUE`, do not show compiler output

Examples

if (FALSE) {
source_cpp(
  code = '#include "cpp11/integers.hpp"

  [[cpp11::export]]
  int num_odd(cpp11::integers x) {
    int total = 0;
    for (int val : x) {
      if ((val % 2) == 1) {
        ++total;
      }
    }
    return total;
  }
  ')

num_odd(as.integer(c(1:10, 15, 23)))
}
